forecast-period.text: An intense low pressure system centred east of Tasmania will move southeast across the Tasman Sea during Saturday. A high pressure system will also move eastwards across the Bight, passing Tasmania on Saturday night and early Sunday. A low pressure trough is then expected to approach western Bass Strait early next week.
Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height.
Details of warnings are available on the Bureau's website www.bom.gov.au, by telephone 1300-659-217* or through some TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecasts for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for neighbouring coastal zones.

area.description: West Coast: SA-VIC Border to Cape Otway

forecast-period.text: Winds: South to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots, reaching up to 25 knots in the far east early in the morning. Winds easing to southerly 10 to 15 knots by midday, tending southeasterly below 10 knots in the evening. Seas: 1 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 metre around midday. Swell: Southwesterly 3 metres. Weather: Cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.

Winds: Southeasterly about 10 knots increasing to 10 to 15 knots in the early afternoon then tending easterly in the late evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 2 to 3 metres, decreasing to 2 metres by early evening. Weather: Partly cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.

Winds: Easterly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: Around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the afternoon or evening. Swell: Southwesterly 1.5 to 2.5 metres. Weather: Partly cloudy. 20% chance of a shower.
